articles.headline: BP Named in Inquiry on Propane Pricing
articles.snippet: Regulators charged that BP pushed up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.
articles.abstract: Regulators charged that BP pushed up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators charged yesterday that BP manipulated the price of propane two years ago by cornering the market through its dominant position, pushing up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.

articles.headline: Iraq War Ends Silently for One American Soldier
articles.snippet: In darkness, 60 U.S. soldiers silently said goodbye to Sgt. Terry Lisk. Such ceremonies have become common.
articles.abstract: In darkness, 60 U.S. soldiers silently said goodbye to Sgt. Terry Lisk. Such ceremonies have become common.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMADI, Iraq, June 28 — A soldier was dead, and it was time for him to go home.

articles.headline: Music Rivals Bid to Buy Each Other
articles.snippet: Years of jockeying to combine the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.
articles.abstract: Years of jockeying to combine the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.
articles.lead_paragraph: Years of jockeying to combine two of the world's biggest music companies, the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group, has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.

articles.headline: Business Joins African Effort to Cut Malaria
articles.snippet: Companies are beginning to join forces with governments in Africa to mount regional campaigns against malaria.
articles.abstract: Companies are beginning to join forces with governments in Africa to mount regional campaigns against malaria.
articles.lead_paragraph: BELULUANE, Mozambique — With malaria spread across southern Mozambique, executives at the international mining company Billiton expected some workers to call in sick as it began building a massive new aluminum smelter amid the cornfields here.

articles.headline: Google Aims to Speed the Online Checkout Line
articles.snippet: In its quest to "organize the world's information," Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.
articles.abstract: In its quest to "organize the world's information," Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.
articles.lead_paragraph: In its quest to "organize the world's information," Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.

articles.headline: With Inventories Bulging, Detroit Rolls Out the Incentives
articles.snippet: To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.
articles.abstract: To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, June 28 — To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.

articles.headline: Israelis Batter Gaza and Seize Hamas Officials
articles.snippet: In the West Bank early on Thursday, Israeli forces arrested the Palestinian deputy prime minister, seven other cabinet ministers and 20 lawmakers in Ramallah.
articles.abstract: In the West Bank early on Thursday, Israeli forces arrested the Palestinian deputy prime minister, seven other cabinet ministers and 20 lawmakers in Ramallah.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA, Thursday, June 29  Israel stepped up its confrontation on Wednesday with Palestinian militants over the capture of an Israeli soldier, battering northern Gazan towns with artillery and sending warplanes over the house of the Syrian president, who is influential with the Palestinian leader believed to have ordered the kidnapping.
articles.byline: By Ian Fisher and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: A Microsoft Safety Package. Grit Your Teeth.
articles.snippet: You might be surprised to find out who just entered the antivirus and anti-spyware market: Microsoft.
articles.abstract: You might be surprised to find out who just entered the antivirus and anti-spyware market: Microsoft.

articles.headline: BP Named in Inquiry on Propane Pricing
articles.snippet: Federal regulators charged yesterday that BP manipulated the price of propane two years ago by cornering the market through its dominant position, pushing up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.     The Commodity ...
articles.abstract: Federal regulators charged yesterday that BP manipulated the price of propane two years ago by cornering the market through its dominant position, pushing up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.     The Commodity Futures Trading Commission charges that at least six current and former employees at a unit of BP North America squeezed the propane market in February 2004, according to a civil complaint filed in federal court. They sought to make at least $20 million in profits, it said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators charged yesterday that BP manipulated the price of propane two years ago by cornering the market through its dominant position, pushing up heating costs for millions of households at the peak of winter demand.

articles.headline: Music Rivals Bid to Buy Each Other
articles.snippet: Years of jockeying to combine two of the world's biggest music companies, the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group, has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.      EMI, based in London, said yesterday that it had raised its re...
articles.abstract: Years of jockeying to combine two of the world's biggest music companies, the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group, has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.      EMI, based in London, said yesterday that it had raised its recent bid for Warner Music, based in New York, to $31 a share, or about $4.6 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Years of jockeying to combine two of the world's biggest music companies, the EMI Group and the Warner Music Group, has escalated with the two now bidding to take over each other.

articles.headline: A Microsoft Safety Package. Grit Your Teeth.
articles.snippet: KEEPING Windows free from viruses, spyware and other nastiness is a chronic headache. These days, the price of security software is just a cost of doing business on Windows PC's. (No e-mail from smug, virus-free Mac fans, please. Not everyone has ...
articles.abstract: KEEPING Windows free from viruses, spyware and other nastiness is a chronic headache. These days, the price of security software is just a cost of doing business on Windows PC's. (No e-mail from smug, virus-free Mac fans, please. Not everyone has a choice.)     So you might be surprised to find out who just entered the antivirus and anti-spyware market this month: Microsoft. Yes, Microsoft, the company whose inattention to security made antivirus software a necessity in the first place.

articles.headline: Israelis Batter Gaza and Seize Hamas Officials
articles.snippet: Israel stepped up its confrontation on Wednesday with Palestinian militants over the capture of an Israeli soldier, battering northern Gazan towns with artillery and sending warplanes over the house of the Syrian president, who is influential with...
articles.abstract: Israel stepped up its confrontation on Wednesday with Palestinian militants over the capture of an Israeli soldier, battering northern Gazan towns with artillery and sending warplanes over the house of the Syrian president, who is influential with the Palestinian leader believed to have ordered the kidnapping.      In the West Bank city of Ramallah early on Thursday, Israeli forces detained 8 ministers of the 24-member Hamas-led cabinet and 20 lawmakers, including Deputy Prime Minister Nasser Shaer and Labor Minister Mohammed Barghouti, The Associated Press reported, citing security officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA, Thursday, June 29 - Israel stepped up its confrontation on Wednesday with Palestinian militants over the capture of an Israeli soldier, battering northern Gazan towns with artillery and sending warplanes over the house of the Syrian president, who is influential with the Palestinian leader believed to have ordered the kidnapping.
articles.byline: By Ian Fisher and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: Google Aims to Speed the Online Checkout Line
articles.snippet: In its quest to ''organize the world's information,'' Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.      The company is introducing Google Checkout today, a service that will allow users to make purchases from onlin...
articles.abstract: In its quest to ''organize the world's information,'' Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.      The company is introducing Google Checkout today, a service that will allow users to make purchases from online stores using payment and shipping information they keep on file with Google.
articles.lead_paragraph: In its quest to "organize the world's information," Google now wants to keep track of your credit card number and where you live.

articles.headline: Justices Uphold Most Remapping in Texas by G.O.P.
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected a broad challenge to Texas's controversial Congressional redistricting plan, giving a victory to the Republican Party and the architect of the plan, Tom DeLay, the former House majority leader.     But at th...
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected a broad challenge to Texas's controversial Congressional redistricting plan, giving a victory to the Republican Party and the architect of the plan, Tom DeLay, the former House majority leader.     But at the same time, the court ruled that the Texas Legislature violated the Voting Rights Act in redrawing a particular district in southwestern Texas when it adopted the plan in 2003. The Legislature had carved up Laredo, removing 100,000 Mexican-Americans and adding an Anglo population from the Hill Country to shore up the faltering prospects of the Republican incumbent.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 - The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected a broad challenge to Texas's controversial Congressional redistricting plan, giving a victory to the Republican Party and the architect of the plan, Tom DeLay, the former House majority leader.

articles.headline: Iraq War Ends Silently for One American Soldier
articles.snippet: A soldier was dead, and it was time for him to go home.      The doors to the little morgue swung open, and six soldiers stepped outside carrying a long black bag zippered at the top.
articles.abstract: A soldier was dead, and it was time for him to go home.      The doors to the little morgue swung open, and six soldiers stepped outside carrying a long black bag zippered at the top.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMADI, Iraq, June 28 - A soldier was dead, and it was time for him to go home.

articles.headline: With Inventories Bulging, Detroit Rolls Out the Incentives
articles.snippet: To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.     Tyson Loffredo, a 30-year-old pizzeria owner in a town near Las Vegas with his eye on a new Dodge Durango Limit...
articles.abstract: To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.     Tyson Loffredo, a 30-year-old pizzeria owner in a town near Las Vegas with his eye on a new Dodge Durango Limited, hopes to squeeze even more savings from the big sport utility vehicle's $36,000 sticker price before he commits.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, June 28 - To many car shoppers, $5,000 off might sound like the deal of the year. The truth is, it might not even be the best deal this week.
